newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia extends deadline for Megawati to quit HQ.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia extends deadline for Megawati to quit HQ.

text.p: A deadline for the closure of an office set up by ousted Indonesian minority party leader Megawati Sukarnoputri was extended to Friday morning, an aide said on Thursday.
The East Jakarta municipality had ordered the office in a two-storey suburban area closed by late Thursday on the grounds that it violated residential zoning regulations.
A Megawati supporter and member of parliament, Tarto Sudiro, told Reuters a letter was received from the municipality at 11:30 a.m. (0430 GMT) giving a 24-hour extension to the order.

The office was set up after police on July 27 evicted Megawati's supporters from the headquarters of the Indonesian Democratic Party (PDI) after she had been ousted as party leader by government-backed rebels.
